newsitem.title: HONG KONG: PRESS DIGEST - HK Newspaper Headlines - Oct 22.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - HK Newspaper Headlines - Oct 22.

text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Hong Kong press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
-- APPLE DAILY - Chinese dissident Wang Xizhe who escaped to the United States last week said he wanted to join the Kuomintang.
-- SING TAO DAILY - The family of jailed Chinese dissident Wang Dan had decided to hire the lawyer who defended the Gang Of Four to defend Wang.
-- MING PAO - A gang in Guangdong province was passing off Portugese escudas as Canadian dollars to local residents.
-- TA KUNG PAO - China's Central Committee had instructed provincial authorities to understand the policy of "one country two systems" that will apply to Hong Kong after the handover.
-- HONG KONG ECONOMIC TIMES - China's Ministry of Posts and Telecommunications said it was considering lowering rates for international long distance calls by at least 20 percent.
-- HONG KONG ECONOMIC JOURNAL -- Head hunters have proposed four candidates to take over as head of the Hong Kong Stock Exchange next year.

-- English-language SOUTH CHINA MORNING POST - The Kowloon and Canton Railway Corp was considering a plan to axe half the staff working on the Western Corridor Railway project. It expects to save at least $20 million a month as a result.

-- English-language HONGKONG STANDARD -- British Foreign Secretary Malcolm Rifkind urged China to explain Chinese Foreign Minister Qian Qichen's comments concerning freedom of expression in post-handover Hong Kong.
